q4.question: What was used to predict that the soldiers had the disease?
q4.answer: ['Whether they have rashes on their bodies', 'They would have a rash on their body']
q4.recall: The rashes on the soldiers' necks and chests were used to predict that they had the disease.

The disease is described as a rabic-like virus that infects the men and makes them turn violent and kill each other. The exact method of how the infection spreads is unknown. The disease is believed to have been dormant for 50 years due to confrontations between North and South Korea.

q6.question: What did Kwon do?
q6.answer: ['asked Yoo for the keys to the generator room at gunpoint', 'Temporarily knocks out the electrical supply']
q6.recall: Kwon encountered a mutating sentry, stabbed him, and was locked back up.
q6.vectordb: Kwon was involved in a struggle with a sentry, broke the sentry's neck, and stabbed him in the hand. He also tried to escape using an ambulance but was stopped by Noh, who fired his gun and caused Kwon to crash into the side of the bunker. Kwon was then locked and tied back up in the generator room. Additionally, Kwon withheld the truth about the disease and the deaths from Noh and his men, which led to Noh beating him up in anger. Kwon also suffocated one of the infected men to death to end his suffering. (k-11, k-10, k-9, k-8)
